label: LumaApi
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Luma API.

tools.name: AddEventGuests
tools.description:
Add guests to an event with default or custom tickets.

Add guests to an event with the status "Going." By default, each guest receives one ticket of the default type. Specify custom ticket assignments if needed.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: AddEventHost
tools.description:
Add a host to an event in Luma.

Use this tool to add a host to an event in Luma. If the host already has a Luma profile, it will automatically be recognized and added.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: AddEventToLumaCalendar
tools.description:
Add an existing event to the Luma calendar.

Use this tool to add an existing event from Luma or another platform to the Luma calendar without managing it there. Useful for integrating events across platforms.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: AddUserToMembershipTier
tools.description:
Add a user to a specified free membership tier.

This tool adds a user to a free membership tier. It should be called whenever there is a need to enroll a user in a free membership program. Note that paid membership tiers are not supported by this tool, as they require a web payment flow.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: ApplyTagToCalendarMembers
tools.description:
Apply a tag to existing calendar members.

Use this tool to assign a specific tag to already existing members of a calendar. It does not create new members but merely updates the tagging for current members.

parameters.name: tag_identifier
parameters.description: The Tag API ID (e.g., 'tag-123') or tag name to be applied to calendar members.

parameters.name: email_addresses
parameters.description: Array of email addresses to apply the tag to existing calendar members.

parameters.name: user_api_ids_to_tag
parameters.description: Array of user API IDs to apply the tag to. Each ID corresponds to a calendar member.

tools.name: CheckEventExistence
tools.description:
Determine if an event exists on the calendar.

Use this tool to find out if an event is already listed on the calendar before deciding to add it.

parameters.name: calendar_platform_type
parameters.description: Specifies the source platform of the event, either 'external' or 'luma'.

parameters.name: event_details_url
parameters.description: The URL of the event page to check if it exists in the calendar.

parameters.name: event_identifier
parameters.description: A unique string identifier for the event to check its existence on the calendar.

tools.name: CreateEvent
tools.description:
Creates and schedules a new event.

This tool allows users to create and schedule a new event using the Luma service. Call this tool when you need to set up a new event with specific details.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: CreateEventCoupon
tools.description:
Create a non-editable coupon for event registration.

Use this tool to create a coupon for guests registering for an event. Once created, the terms of the coupon cannot be edited.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: CreateEventTicketType
tools.description:
Create a new ticket type for an event.

Use this tool to create a new ticket type for an event. Call this when you need to specify different ticket categories for an event.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"eventId":"12345","ticketTypeName":"VIP Ticket","price":99.99,"quantityAvailable":100,"description":"Access to VIP area with complimentary drinks."}

tools.name: CreatePersonTag
tools.description:
Create a new person tag in the calendar system.

This tool is used to create a new person tag within the calendar system, allowing for the organization and tagging of individuals.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"tagName":"Project Manager","description":"Tags for project managers in the calendar system."}

tools.name: DeletePersonTag
tools.description:
Deletes a person tag from the calendar.

Use this tool to delete a person tag from a calendar entry when modifications are needed. It confirms the successful removal of the tag.

parameters.name: tag_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the person tag to be deleted. It should match the tag's API ID.

tools.name: GenerateEventCoupon
tools.description:
Create a coupon for calendar-managed events.

This tool generates a coupon applicable to any event managed by the calendar. Ensure the coupon code is unique to avoid conflicts between specific events and the calendar.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: GenerateUploadUrl
tools.description:
Generates a URL for image upload.

Use this tool to generate a URL where images can be uploaded. This is useful when you need to upload images to the Luma service.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: GetEventAdminInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve admin information for an accessible event.

This tool is used to get administrative details about an event for which the user has management access. It should be called when detailed event information is required by an admin.

parameters.name: event_api_id
parameters.description: Event API ID, starting with 'evt-', used to identify the event.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the event, usually starts with 'evt-'.

tools.name: GetEventGuest
tools.description:
Retrieve event guest details using their ID.

Use this tool to get details of an event guest by specifying their ID. It facilitates looking up guests through various parameters.

parameters.name: event_api_id
parameters.description: Provide the unique API ID for the event to retrieve guest details.

parameters.name: event_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of the event, typically starting with 'evt-'. Used to identify the specific event.

parameters.name: guest_api_id
parameters.description: The unique API ID of the guest, distinct from the user ID. This is used for identifying the guest within the system.

parameters.name: guest_email
parameters.description: The email address of the event guest to look up.

parameters.name: guest_identifier
parameters.description: Identifier for looking up the guest, such as guest ID (gst-), ticket key, guest key (g-), or the user's email.

parameters.name: proxy_key
parameters.description: Value of the `pk` parameter from the check-in QR code used to identify the guest.

tools.name: GetEventGuests
tools.description:
Retrieve registered or invited guests for an event.

Use this tool to obtain a list of guests who have registered or been invited to a specific event.

parameters.name: event_api_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the event, typically starting with 'evt-'.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the event, usually starts with 'evt-'.

parameters.name: guest_approval_status
parameters.description: Filter guests by their approval status. Options: 'approved', 'session', 'pending_approval', 'invited', 'declined', 'waitlist'.

parameters.name: guest_sort_column
parameters.description: The column to sort the guest list by. Options are 'name', 'email', 'created_at', 'registered_at', or 'checked_in_at'.

parameters.name: items_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the number of guest entries to return. The server enforces a maximum limit.

parameters.name: next_cursor_value
parameters.description: Value of `next_cursor` from a previous request to paginate through results.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specify the order for sorting the list of guests. Acceptable values are 'asc', 'desc', 'asc nulls last', or 'desc nulls last'.

tools.name: GetTicketTypeById
tools.description:
Retrieve event ticket type details by ID.

Use this tool to get detailed information about a specific ticket type by providing its ID. Ideal for fetching ticket-related details for events.

parameters.name: event_ticket_type_api_id
parameters.description: The unique API ID for the event ticket type. It must be provided to retrieve ticket information.

parameters.name: ticket_type_id
parameters.description: The ID of the ticket type to retrieve, typically starts with 'ett-'.

tools.name: GetUserInfo
tools.description:
Retrieve the user's personal information and profile details.

This tool is used to fetch the current user's personal details, including profile information. It can be called when an application needs to access the user's data for personalization or account management purposes.

tools.name: ImportPeopleToCalendar
tools.description:
Import people to your calendar from contact lists.

This tool is used to import individuals from contact lists into your calendar, making it simple to invite them to events and send newsletters. Use this when you need to manage and communicate with attendees efficiently.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: ListCalendarCoupons
tools.description:
Retrieve all coupons for a calendar.

Use this tool to obtain a comprehensive list of all coupons that have been created for a specific calendar.

parameters.name: items_to_return
parameters.description: The number of coupon items to retrieve. The server enforces a maximum limit.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Provide the `next_cursor` value obtained from a prior request to paginate through results.

tools.name: ListEventCoupons
tools.description:
Retrieve all coupons created for an event.

Use this tool to obtain a list of all coupons that have been generated for a specific event. This tool is useful for managing and analyzing promotional strategies linked to events.

parameters.name: event_api_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the event, typically starting with 'evt-'. Required to list coupons for the specified event.

parameters.name: event_identifier
parameters.description: Event ID, typically starting with 'evt-'. It identifies the specific event for which to list coupons.

parameters.name: item_return_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the number of items to return in the response, up to the server's maximum allowed.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Value of `next_cursor` from a previous request to continue pagination.

tools.name: ListEventTicketTypes
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of all ticket types for an event.

Use this tool to get a detailed list of available ticket types for a specific event. It is useful for understanding ticket options and pricing for attendees.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for an event, typically starting with 'evt-'.

parameters.name: event_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the event, usually starting with evt-.

parameters.name: include_hidden_ticket_types
parameters.description: Set to true to include hidden ticket types in the response list.

tools.name: ListLumaCalendarEvents
tools.description:
Retrieve all events managed by your Luma Calendar.

Use this tool to list all events managed by your Luma Calendar. It does not include events that are listed but not managed by the Calendar.

parameters.name: event_sort_direction
parameters.description: Defines the order of events. Use 'asc' or 'desc' for ascending or descending. Options 'asc nulls last' and 'desc nulls last' place nulls at the end.

parameters.name: filter_events_before
parameters.description: Filter events to show only those happening before this ISO 8601 Datetime. Example: 2022-10-19T03:27:13.673Z

parameters.name: number_of_items_to_return
parameters.description: The number of events to return. The server enforces a maximum limit.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Use the `next_cursor` value from a previous request to continue listing events.

parameters.name: sort_by_column
parameters.description: Specify the column to sort events by. For now, 'start_at' is the available option.

parameters.name: start_date_after
parameters.description: Specify the starting datetime to filter events after this timestamp in ISO 8601 format (e.g., 2022-10-19T03:27:13.673Z).

tools.name: ListMembershipTiers
tools.description: Retrieve available membership tiers for the calendar.

parameters.name: items_to_return_count
parameters.description: Specify the number of membership tiers to return. The server may enforce a maximum limit.

parameters.name: previous_request_next_cursor
parameters.description: The `next_cursor` value from a prior request for fetching subsequent data.

tools.name: ListPeople
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of people from the calendar.

Use this tool to obtain a list of people associated with the calendar.

parameters.name: calendar_membership_status
parameters.description: Specify the membership status for filtering calendar members. This is only relevant for calendar memberships.

parameters.name: calendar_membership_tier_api_id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the calendar membership tier to filter people.

parameters.name: calendar_tier_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the calendar membership tier to filter people.

parameters.name: filter_by_tags
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of tag names or IDs to filter people with specified tags.

parameters.name: items_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the number of items to return in the response. The server may enforce a maximum limit.

parameters.name: pagination_next_cursor
parameters.description: Provide the `next_cursor` value from a previous request to continue pagination.

parameters.name: search_query
parameters.description: Search for people using names or emails.

parameters.name: sort_by_column
parameters.description: Sort the list of people by a specified column: created_at, event_checked_in_count, event_approved_count, name, or revenue_usd_cents.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specifies the order for sorting results: 'asc', 'desc', 'asc nulls last', or 'desc nulls last'.

tools.name: ListPersonTags
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of tags associated with persons.

This tool is used to call the Luma API to get a list of tags that are associated with persons. It should be called when there's a need to retrieve person tags from the Luma service.

parameters.name: items_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the number of tags to return. The server will impose a maximum limit.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Use the `next_cursor` value from a previous response to paginate results.

parameters.name: sort_by_column
parameters.description: Specifies the column to sort the tags by. Options are 'name', 'color', or 'created_at'.

parameters.name: sorting_direction
parameters.description: Specifies the order direction of the person tags. Choose from 'asc', 'desc', 'asc nulls last', or 'desc nulls last'.

tools.name: LumaEntityLookup
tools.description:
Lookup an entity on Luma by its slug.

Use this tool to fetch detailed information about an entity from Luma using a specific slug identifier.

parameters.name: entity_slug
parameters.description: The unique string identifier for the entity to be looked up in Luma.

tools.name: ModifyCoupon
tools.description:
Update a coupon's details in the system.

Use this tool to update the details of an existing coupon. It should be called when changes to coupon parameters are needed, such as expiration date or discount value.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: RemoveTagFromCalendarMembers
tools.description:
Remove a tag from existing calendar members.

Use this tool to remove a specified tag from existing members of a calendar. Intended for managing and updating member tags efficiently.

parameters.name: tag_identifier
parameters.description: The ID or name of the tag to remove from calendar members, such as 'tag-123' or 'Birthday'.

parameters.name: email_addresses_to_remove_tag
parameters.description: Array of email addresses to remove the tag from the calendar members.

parameters.name: user_api_ids_to_remove_tag
parameters.description: Array of user API IDs from which to remove the specified tag.

tools.name: SendGuestEventInvite
tools.description:
Send event invitations to guests via email and SMS.

This tool sends an invitation to guests for an event by email and SMS, leveraging the Luma service. It is useful when you need to notify guests about an event quickly and ensure they receive the invitation through multiple channels.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: SoftDeleteTicketType
tools.description:
Soft delete a ticket type if certain conditions are met.

Use this tool to soft delete a ticket type, provided no tickets have been sold and it's not the last visible type.

parameters.name: event_ticket_type_id
parameters.description: The ID of the event ticket type to be soft deleted. Ensure no tickets are sold, and it's not the last visible type before deletion.

tools.name: UpdateCoupon
tools.description:
Updates a coupon in the calendar.

Use this tool to modify the details of an existing coupon in the Luma calendar system.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: UpdateEvent
tools.description:
Update event details using Luma's API.

This tool updates event information using Luma's event update endpoint. It should be called when modifications to event details are required.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: UpdateGuestStatus
tools.description:
Updates the status of an event guest.

Use this tool to change the status of a guest in an event, such as marking them as confirmed, declined, or pending.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: UpdateMembershipStatus
tools.description:
Update a member's membership status and handle payments.

Use this tool to approve or decline a member's membership status. Approving a paid tier member will capture their payment, while declining will cancel any active subscription.

parameters.name: membership_status
parameters.description: Set the membership status to either 'approved' to capture payment or 'declined' to cancel the subscription.

parameters.name: user_identifier
parameters.description: User ID (e.g., 'usr-xxx') or email address to identify the member whose status is to be updated.

tools.name: UpdatePersonTag
tools.description:
Updates a tag for a person in the calendar system.

This tool is used to update a person's tag within the calendar system. It should be called when there is a need to change or assign a new label to a person in a calendar context.

parameters.name: person_tag_api_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the tag to be updated. It is required to identify which tag needs modification.

parameters.name: tag_color
parameters.description: Specify the color to be assigned to the person's tag. Choose from: cranberry, barney, red, green, blue, purple, yellow, orange.

parameters.name: tag_name
parameters.description: The new name for the tag to be updated. It should be descriptive and relevant to the person's role or status.

tools.name: UpdateTicketTypeConfiguration
tools.description:
Update an existing ticket type configuration.

Use this tool to modify the settings of a ticket type for an event. It should be called when changes to a ticket type's details or availability are required.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

documentationChunks.content:
## Authentication

The Arcade Luma API MCP Server requires one environment variable to authenticate with the [Luma API](https://docs.luma.com/reference/getting-started-with-your-api):

- `LUMA_API_KEY`

**How to obtain your credentials:**

1. Navigate to your [Luma dashboard](https://lu.ma/)
2. Click on your profile icon and go to **Settings**
3. Navigate to **API** or **Developer Settings**
4. Click **Generate API Key** or **Create New Key**
5. Copy the API key and store it securely

<Callout type="warning">
  The Luma API requires a **Luma Plus** subscription. Be careful with your API
  key since it provides full access to your Luma account.
</Callout>

For more details, see the [Luma API Getting Started guide](https://docs.luma.com/reference/getting-started-with-your-api).

summary:
LumaApi provides tools that facilitate LLMs in interacting seamlessly with the Luma API to manage events and user memberships. This toolkit allows developers to efficiently handle event creation, guest management, and membership features.

**Capabilities**
- Create, update, and manage events and their details.
- Add and update guests, hosts, and members for events.
- Generate and manage event tickets and coupons.
- Import people and apply tags to streamline calendar management.

**OAuth**
- No OAuth configurations required; utilize API key for access.

**Secrets**
- Secret Type: API Key 
  - Example: LUMA_API_KEY (used for authenticating API requests).
